com.github.uberroot.ncjbot.modapi

Interface OverlayManager

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Exclusive<OverlayManager>, UnsafeObject<OverlayManager>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LazyOverlayManager

    public interface OverlayManager
extends Exclusive<OverlayManager>, UnsafeObject<OverlayManager>

    An interface for modules that manage the overlay network. Classes implementing this interface are responsible for maintaining the associations between this node and other nodes in the network, as well as monitoring which nodes are available for use.

    Author:
    Carter Waxman

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addDiscoveredNode(RemoteNode rn)
      Directly adds a new node to the OverlayManager.
      java.util.List<RemoteNode> getActiveNodes()
      Retrieves a copy of the known active nodes for the network.
      java.util.List<RemoteNode> getNodes(int count)
      Gets requested number of nodes, wrapping the list around when not enough are known to create a list of unique nodes.
      RemoteNode getReplacement(RemoteNode r)
      Finds a randomly selected replacement node for the node given.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.github.uberroot.ncjbot.UnsafeObject

        getSafeObject

    • Method Detail

      • getActiveNodes

        java.util.List<RemoteNode> getActiveNodes()

        Retrieves a copy of the known active nodes for the network.

        Returns:
        The known active nodes for the network.

      • addDiscoveredNode

        boolean addDiscoveredNode(RemoteNode rn)

        Directly adds a new node to the OverlayManager.

        Parameters:
        rn - the node to add
        Returns:
        True if the node was an addition to the OverlayManager, false if the node was already known.

      • getReplacement

        RemoteNode getReplacement(RemoteNode r)

        Finds a randomly selected replacement node for the node given. If there are no nodes available to replace the one provided, this method will return null.

        Parameters:
        r - The node to replace.
        Returns:
        A randomly selected node from the OverlayManager.

      • getNodes

        java.util.List<RemoteNode> getNodes(int count)

        Gets requested number of nodes, wrapping the list around when not enough are known to create a list of unique nodes.

        Parameters:
        count - The number of nodes to retrieve. A value of -1 indicates that all nodes should be retrieved.
        Returns:
        A list of count remote nodes.
